item.title: Red paint on roundabout, 12th September
item.description:
Someone has vandalised the mini roundabout and painted St George’s cross on it. Please paint over the hate.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Park, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Construction signs obstruct view of approaching traffic, 12th September
item.description:
Shire cars site Turning right from Leckhampton Lane into the A46 is quite tricky to negotiate – because of the angle of Leckhampton Lane, if cars are coming north on the A46 and turning into Leckhampton Lane, they quite often cut across the corner meaning you have to hang back, but even going up to the line (pictured here) it’s very hard to see oncoming traffic because of those signs attached to the security fencing. Contractors should move these to another section of fence so it’s easier to see traffic approaching south on the A46. Particularly when turning right, you have to look quite rapidly between the traffic approaching from the south and the traffic approaching from the north, and it would be easy for a car to be hidden behind those sections of fencing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shurdington Road, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: Multiple potholes in Westbourne Drive where at least a few have been made worse by shoddy repairs . The whole road is a mess with multiple bumps and potholes, 12th September
item.description:
The length of Westbourne Drive
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westbourne Drive, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes dig out again, 12th September
item.description:
The potholes are at the junction of St Margarets Road and Barrington Drive. They were last 'fixed' in December 2024 to a poor standard (note behind the pot holes is a patch dug and filled by Severn Trent at around the same time, this is in perfect condition). The potholes are spewing gravel all over the road, making it dangerous. Please can this be fixed to a quality standard so it doesn't break up again

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Saint Margarets Road, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegal Parking, 12th September
item.description:
Residents at 24 and 26 Prestbury Road are unable to park in the rear of their properties due to the inconsiderate parking of a car and camper van (over the old double yellow lines) in Malden Road (the camper van has not moved in years as it is not used and the car very rarely moves - this is causing huge access problems for waste disposal and access to further down the road businesses and to nursing home, pharmacy and Pittville lawn residents etc. Vehicle damage and illegal demolition of Grade II Listed Building walls is continuing to occur on a daily basis whist the outstanding 3 metres of double yellow lines would "fix the problem" I have dated videos of the traffic problems live if you provide an access point to prove the problem.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, Malden Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: This van broke down several weeks ago and has been left here in a very difficult position. Cars turning into this v busy lane as it’s used as a cut through, on the wrong side of the road. They are then reversing back towards the main road . Many people are now complaining about the difficulty of where this van has been left . It’s compounded by the fact that people , incl children use this lane to walk down to school, 12th September
item.description:
Farm lane is small - it’s right at the entrance as you turn off church road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Farm Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
